problem.markdown:
While human intuition often associates natural phenomenon with a single event (like a bernoulli random variable), some situations are better described by a series of events. If there is a 0.01% chance that a tsunami will crash on a shore of a given day what is the probability that (answer in decimal):
>> a. You will be safe on a given day? << =0.9999 [Explanation] 1 - 0.0001 = 0.9999 [Explanation]
>> b. You will be safe if you live here for 20 years (assuming 1 year = 365 days)?<< =0.4819+-0.0001 [Explanation] (1 - 0.0001)^(365*20) = 0.482 [Explanation]
